title.narrative: IR 1.6 Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) AND PEDIATRIC AIDS

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 1.6 Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) and Pediatric AIDS Capacity strengthened in target districts to scale up quality services for prevention of mother-to-child transmission of HIV (PMTCT), pediatric, maternal and adolescent AIDS/TB care and treatment, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable access and use of high impact reproductive, maternal and neonatal, child and adolescent health and nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Procurement and or supply management for HIV diagnostics and medicine
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health
